entries.text: The Perl Foundation is launching its round of grant proposals for March. Deadline: March 23rd.
entries.title: Call For Grant Proposals (March 2016 Round)
entries.author: makoto_nozaki

entries.text: Hot from the presses: the QA Hackaton has a new sponsor.
entries.title: ZipRecruiter is sponsoring the QA Hackathon
entries.author: neil_bowers

entries.text: A preliminary list of YAPC::NA's tutorial is now available.
entries.title: YAPC::NA Tutorials

entries.text: While the blo entry itself is more of a blurb, it contains links to the presentation Moritz gave on the topic at the German Perl Workshop and to his book-in-progress.
entries.title: Continuous Delivery for Libraries?
entries.author: moritz_lenz
peteris_krumins
entries.title: Frameworks don't make much sense
entries.text: Reading this piece, the expression "Go Big, or Go Home" comes to mind. Peteris argues that frameworks are bad. What framework?  _All_ of them.

One of the oft-forgotten things about the t/ directory and 'prove' is that tests don't necessarily need to be Perl code. Here Pawel shows how one can  painlessly mix and match Perl 5 and Perl 6 tests in a testsuite.
entries.title: Running mixed Perl 5 and Perl 6 tests.
Munging lcpan text output with 'td'
entries.text: Even if you don't use lcpan, this is a nice entry also showcasing cli tools to manipulate and report JSON-like data.
entries.author: steven_haryanto
tom_wyant
entries.title: Son of MacPorts openssl versus Perl
entries.text: A quick follow-up on Tom's original blog entry on the woes of having openssl and Perl play nice together on MacOS.

entries.author: david_golden
entries.text: Perhaps you are the type of conservative soul who prefers consistency over sheer performance? Rejoice, for MongoDB has a new knob to adjust its behavior in that regard.
entries.title: No more dirty reads with MongoDB
It's never too late to find a bug
entries.text: Some bugs are easy to spot. Others can be sneaky. Blending with their surrounding, waiting patiently for years before the right circumstances present themselves. The present tale is about a bug of the latter category, which stayed dormant for over five years before resurfacing...
entries.author: philippe_bruhat

entries.text: Last summer, WWW::Shorten was put up for adoption. And now, happy news, somebody answered the call. New releases are already trickling in.
entries.title: Reviving WWW::Shorten

entries.text: In the new things this week in Perl 6-land: one of the good introduction tutorials to Perl 6 is now available in French and German.
entries.title: 2016.10 Enchanté!
NICEPERL's lists
entries.text: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.
entries.author: miguel_prz

subject: Thirty Score Subscribers, WOOHOO!
header: This week, we're celebrating our 6,000th subscriber! And in 8 weeks we'll be hitting our 250th edition. And 10 weeks after that, it's the 5th anniversary (really?) milestone that we'll reach. I don't know about you, but I'd say that all those occasions call for a momentous celebratory camel cake. Enjoy! (this edition of the PerlWeekly, that is, not the yet-to-be-baked cake) ~ `/anick
